meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling an arch or vault
meanings.sent1: The fornical doorway had a curved shape.
meanings.sent2: The ancient building had fornical ceilings.
meanings.sent3: The fornical design of the bridge made it look majestic.
meanings.sent5: The fornical structure stood tall and grand.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a fornix, especially the fornix of the brain
meanings.sent1: The fornical pathways in the brain are important for memory.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the fornical connections in the brain.
meanings.sent3: His fornical brain waves seemed to be in sync.
meanings.sent4: The fornical network of the brain was complex.
meanings.sent5: The fornical brain region played a crucial role in cognition.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a fornix, especially the fornix of the vagina
meanings.sent1: The fornical structure of the vagina provides support.
meanings.sent2: Doctors discussed the fornical anatomy during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: She felt a strange fornical sensation in her abdomen.
